isis.stitle: VT 275 Engine Diagnostics Manual - Engine Symptoms Diagnostics - Test Procedures - Low Oil Pressure

entry.para: Low oil level: oil leak, oil consumption or incorrect servicing
High oil level: incorrect servicing, fuel in oil or coolant in oil
Missing oil gallery cup plugs (front or rear)
Broken, missing or loose piston cooling tube(s)
Missing, damaged or worn bearing inserts or camshaft bushings
Lifter missing (will also have performance problems)

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, death, including damage to the engine or vehicle, comply with the following;

item.para: When routing test line do not, crimp line, run line too close to moving parts, or let line touch hot engine surfaces.
Before running engine for diagnostic or service procedures, set parking brake, shift transmission to park or neutral, and block wheels.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury or death, do not allow engine fluids to stay on your skin. Clean skin and nails with soap and water, or a good hand cleaner. Wash or properly dispose of clothing or rags containing engine fluids. Engine fluids contain elements that may be unhealthy for skin and could cause cancer.

note.para: Engine fluids, oil, fuel, and coolant, are a threat to the environment. Recycle or dispose of engine fluids according to local regulations. Never put engine fluids in the trash, on the ground, in sewers or other bodies of water.

step1.para: Verify oil level in engine using oil level gauge while vehicle is parked on level ground. Check to see if oil is contaminated with fuel or coolant.

item.para: Engine oil level will vary depending on temperature of engine
If oil is contaminated, go to " Fuel in Lube Oil " or " Coolant in Lube Oil " in this section.

step1.para: Connect fitting on test line with Fuel/Oil Pressure Test Coupler to a 0 to 1723 kPa (0 - 250 psi) gauge.
Remove EOP switch and install Fuel Pressure Test Fitting.
Connect Fuel/Oil Pressure Test Coupler to Fuel Pressure Test Fitting
Start the engine and measure oil pressure at both low and high idle, under no load conditions. Engine must be at normal operating temperature.

item.para:
If oil pressure reads within specification listed in " Appendix A: VT 275 Performance Specifications
" and the instrument panel indicator indicated low pressure, perform " EOP (Engine Oil Pressure) Switch
" diagnostics in the " Electronic Control Systems Diagnostics
" section of this manual, and repair or replace the oil pressure indicator as required.
If oil pressure does not read within the specification, continue with step 6.

step1.para: Remove and inspect oil pressure regulator as described in the Engine Service Manual.

item.para: The oil pressure regulator piston should move freely in its bore in the front cover.

If oil pressure regulator is functional and passes visual inspection, reinstall regulator following the procedures in the Engine Service Manual. Redo the "Low Oil Pressure Diagnostics" procedures starting with step 5. If oil pressure remains low, continue with step 7.

step1.para: Remove and inspect the lube oil pump following the procedure in the Engine Service Manual.

item.para: Inspect the lube oil pump housing and cover for gouging or deep scratches.
Inspect the gerotor gears for excessive wear or damage.
If no excessive damage is found continue with step 8.

step1.para: Drain oil from engine using a clean drain pan. Inspect oil drain plug magnet, drained oil and oil filter for foreign debris.

item.para: An oil sample should be taken to determine level of engine wear metals and contaminants in the oil.

step1.para: Remove both the upper and lower oil pans following the procedure in the Engine Service Manual. Inspect for missing, loose or damaged oil pickup tube, O-ring, piston cooling tubes, bearing inserts, and cam bushings.

caution.para: To avoid damage to the engine, verify the oil filter is intact. Running the engine with a failed oil filter could cause rapid deterioration of the engine due to dirty oil.

step1.para: Reinstall the oil filter, the oil filter cap, the oil pump, and oil pump cover.
Connect regulated shop air line to the ICP system test adapter in the lube oil filter base.
Slowly apply air pressure in 34.5 kPa (5 psi) increments to 345 kPa (50 psi).

item.para: If a major leak is observed from the front cover area, continue with step 14.
If a major leak is observed from the rear cover area, continue with step 16.
If a major leak is not observed, remove engine from vehicle. Disassemble engine and perform full inspection of all components following procedures in the Engine Service Manual.

step1.para: Remove the front cover from the engine following procedures in the Engine Service Manual and complete inspection of the lube oil pump.

figure.caption: Main oil gallery cup plug locations

step1.para: With front cover removed from the engine, verify that the front main oil gallery cup plugs are in position and not damaged.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, death, including damage to the engine or vehicle, the engine must be supported before removing rear cover of engine.

figure.caption: Rear main oil gallery cup plug locations

step1.para: Remove the rear cover from the engine as described in the Engine Service Manual. Verify the rear main oil gallery cup plugs are in position and not damaged.
